intro: Papaver agrivagum, commonly known as the agrarian poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It features striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange, with a prominent central stigma. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Its capsule fruit contains numerous elliptical seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Papaver agrivagum is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides and in agricultural fields.
